comment.author: 8963119@N07
comment._content: Port Jackson & Manly Steamship Company, Paddle Wheeler "Brighton" docking at Circular Quay, Sydney.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: At the time the Manly Jetty was on the west side of Circular Quay, near what is now the Overseas Passenger Terminal. See 1890 Sydney map www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm1280-s1-v

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: History of the 'Brighton' - www.ferriesofsydney.com/brighton.html The town of Manly was known as Brighton (in the parish of Manly) on early (1875) maps. Hence all the English name references - Steyne, New Brighton Hotel etc. www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-f110-sd&rgn=0.5...

comment.author: 63186071@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Historic Sydney, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
